div.p: I did a 3 year course in a City & Guilds at an Agricultural College which was block release at the time and involved sort of going into college
doing the theory and doing some practical work and then going back on an apprenticeship into a company and being trained by their
more experienced technicians inside that company. I enjoyed the learning from the more experienced technicians in the company
that we worked for and getting their knowledge off those and then going back to the college part it was the learning the whys and whyfores
of how it all worked and how it was meant to work and also learning with my fellow peers when we had some good fun.
